result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Mandatory  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

records.addlTxt:
Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Deft. is sentenced to 48 months in the WSP; 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 30 months Extended Supervision.  Credit given for 67 days.  DE is eligible for CIP & SAP.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 36 months and Ignition Interlock is ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearem Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carl Johnson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 11/25/14 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
